CatDescriptText: Signs on windows read "Republican Party Candidates, Mayor: Joseph A. McArdle; Member of Council: Theodore H. Doehla, Joseph B. Bagley, Kurt J. Lesker, Guy C. Read, Walter V. Richardson." "Vote the Regular Democratic Ticket, City of Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence...Thomas J. Gallagher...Allegheny County...A. Marshall Thompson, Harry M. Montgomery, Homer S. Brown, William F. Cercone, Henry Ellenbogen, John J. Kennedy...A. L. Wolk, John G. Brosky, William H. Davis, Dr. Wm D. McClelland, Thomas E. Barrett..."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1957, pg. A3, reads: "Pat Corr's Plan - This advertisement in 16th District of the Fifth Ward polling place (similar to others in the Hill District) was part of Pat Corr's bid to win nomination for Judge of Common Pleas Court Tuesday. Placing this display card beside that of the regular Democratic ticket, indicated his support of all endorsed candidates except the judges.  In spite of this and help from employers of Prothonotary David B. Roberts office, latest unofficial returns show the strategy failed, and Mr. Corr trailed the six incumbent judges. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Homer S. Brown, Wilhelmina Brown, Byrd Brown, and others posed in front of building with signs for Republican party candidates, and Democratic ticket
